title: Soap spoilers: Death in Emmerdale, Coronation Street tragedy, EastEnders devastation
text:
It’s another dramatic week in soapland as Emmerdale airs the final scenes of Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) – but how will Aaron Dingle (Danny Miller) cope without him? EastEnders sees Martin Fowler (James Bye) and Ben Mitchell’s (Max Bowden) crime spree continues – with violent consequences.

Over in Coronation Street, David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) is having a bad week as he learns that he could lose Max Turner (Harry McDermott) and then he comes face to face with evil Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton). And in Hollyoaks, Scott Drinkwell (Ross Adams) delivers an ultimatum.

David comes face to face with Josh in Coronation Street

David is in a foul mood after discovering that Marion is going to go for custody of Max and as he heads to the hospital wing to get his medication, he is stunned to see Josh being treated and learns that he in prison for drugging and raping someone.

One to watch: Friday 18th October at 7:30pm on ITV.

Robert and Aaron flee Emmerdale

Unable to face years in prison, Robert decides to go on the run from the law and Aaron decides to go with him. After a conversation with Liv, Aaron makes his mind up and the couple say emotional goodbyes to their loved ones.

One to watch: Tuesday 14th October at 7pm on ITV.

Martin is injured thanks to Ben in EastEnders

Ben instructs Martin to do another job for him but Martin insists that he doesn’t need him to come along with him. Later, things get out of hand and Martin ends up seriously injured – and a frantic Sonia demands answers about what is going on.

One to watch: Thursday 17th October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

Sinead can’t undertake simple tasks anymore in Coronation Street

Sinead heads out for a family picnic but finds herself too ill to stay and she ends up having to go home. With Sinead admitting to Beth that she can’t even carry out simple tasks, Kirk realises she won’t make it to Christmas and gets everyone to help plan an early festive day for her.

Mitchell is torn by his feelings in Hollyoaks

As Mitchell continues to struggle with his feelings, he is worried when Anita takes to the stage and means business. With Cleo oblivious and happier than ever, Scott confronts Mitchell who tells him that he loves Cleo but wants Anita – and he doesn’t know what to do for the best.

One to watch: Monday 14th October at 7pm on E4.

Rainie takes devastating action in EastEnders

Stuart is still furious with Kathy for what she did to Rainie and blackmails her into letting Rainie spend time with Abi. But as Rainie takes Abi to the park, Stuart is devastated by what he finds. With Rainie in ruins, Stuart turns on Kathy and threatens to hurt Ben and Ian.

One to watch: Tuesday 15th October at 7:30pm on BBC One.

Gemma is trapped in Coronation Street

Gemma manages to net VIP tickets to a football match but is mortified when the fire brigade have to dismantle a turn stile to free her when she becomes trapped. However, it gets her some media attention and soon a PR is trying to get her press coverage.

One to watch: Wednesday 16th October at 7:30pm on ITV.

Faith confronts Pete over Moira in Emmerdale

Faith tries to restore things between a struggling Cain and Moira but when she sees Pete and Moira having a hushed conversation, she is suspicious and confronts Pete. Pete heads to Moira and warns her that Faith is onto her.

One to watch: Wednesday 16th October at 7pm on ITV.

Joel threatens Mercedes in Hollyoaks

After Tony finds Harry’s phone, it ends up in Joel’s hands and he hears the confession between Mercedes and Liam. He heads to Mercedes and tells her he wants her to spend some time with her family – before he then reports her to the police.

One to watch: Monday 14th October at 7pm on E4.

Whitney makes an admission in EastEnders

Leo continues to woo Whitney but she has second thoughts when she sees Callum. Later, Whitney is confused when Tiffany recognises Leo and Leo fears that his best laid plans will be ruined. Afterwards, Whitney gets drunk and makes an admission.

One to watch: Friday 18th October at 8pm on BBC One.
